name: Crouzeix's conjecture
summary: Crouzeix's conjecture is an unsolved problem in matrix analysis that states for any square matrix \(A\) and any polynomial \(p\), the norm of the matrix \(p(A)\) is less than or equal to 2 times the maximum value of \(|p(z)|\) on the matrix's numerical range \(W(A)\). This inequality is written as \(||p(A)||\le 2\sup _{z\in W(A)}|p(z)|\).Â
